We are moving back now, from our close preoccupation with the teacher and the

NARRATOR: Where are we looking from?
From the technological environment of the twentieth
century. . , committed to mass education. . . oriented to
mass communication. . .
What are we looking at?
At television as an electronic instrument. . . a channel. . .
a device. . . one of a long line of resources which
man has devised to extend the horizons of his own
mind.
What are we looking for?
What education has always looked for, through one
effort or another. You say it, . .
